attributes.action: Oppose the Expansion of the BBC Licence Fee to Streaming-Only Households
attributes.additional_details:
No BBC Consumption: Many UK households rely solely on streaming platforms and do not use BBC services. It is unfair to force them to subsidise a service they do not watch.

Unjust Taxation on Choice: Charging a licence fee based on owning a TV or internet connection rather than actual BBC usage is outdated and penalises those who prefer on-demand streaming over live television.
attributes.background: We, the undersigned, urge the UK Government to reject any proposals that would require households that do not watch live TV or BBC content to pay the BBC licence fee.

departments.name: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

rejection.details: You may wish to sign this petition which calls for a similar action: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/716361
